pkgmetadata.longdescription: CONCOR and Supplemental Functions // Contains the CONCOR (CONvergence of iterated CORrelations) algorithm and a series of supplemental functions for easy running, plotting, and blockmodeling. The CONCOR algorithm is used on social network data to identify network positions based off a definition of structural equivalence; see Breiger, Boorman, and Arabie (1975) doi:10.1016/0022-2496(75)90028-0 and Wasserman and Faust's book Social Network Analysis: Methods and Applications (1994). This version allows multiple relationships for the same set of nodes and uses both incoming and outgoing ties to find positions.
